abstract: UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Bolivar and Giselle Almonte of Manhattan's Inwood neighborhood send their son Sebastian to summer camp.
lead_paragraph: Sebastian Almonte, 9, spends much of his time acting like a grown-up when he helps care for his sister, Ixtell, 7, who has cerebral palsy. But a camp provided him with opportunities to learn, play and make friends.

headline.main: Summer Camp Allows Manhattan Boy to Be a Child Again
headline.print_headline: A Manhattan Summer Camp Allows a 9-Year-Old to Be a Child Again

snippet: Sebastian Almonte, 9, spends much of his time acting like a grown-up when he helps care for his sister, Ixtell, 7, who has cerebral palsy. But a camp provided him with opportunities to learn, play and make friends.
